meanings.sent1: In the lab, the fungi will sporulate under specific conditions.
meanings.sent2: Certain plants sporulate during the fall season to spread their seeds.
meanings.sent3: The mushrooms decided to sporulate at the spore party.
meanings.sent4: The dandelion's fluffy seeds sporulate in the wind, spreading far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The bacteria sporulate to protect themselves from harsh environments.

meanings.sent1: After a period of growth, the bacteria will sporulate to survive.
meanings.sent2: The yeast cells sporulate when nutrients are scarce.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar felt like it was time to sporulate and become a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The idea began to sporulate in his mind, growing stronger with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The spores sporulate inside the capsule, ready to be released into the environment.
